question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The sign function $\text{sgn}(x)$ is defined by \[\text{sgn}(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} -1 \quad &\text{if } x < 0 \\ 0 \quad &\text{if } x = 0 \\ 1 \quad &\text{if } x > 0. \end{aligned} \right. \]Compute $\sum_{n=-10}^{20} \text{sgn}(n).$
inference:
We compute the sum by breaking it into three sums:
$$\begin{split} \sum_{n=-10}^{20} \text{sgn}(n) &= \sum_{n=-10}^{-1} \text{sgn}(n) + \sum_{n=0}^0 \text{sgn}(n) + \sum_{n=1}^{20} \text{sgn}(n) \\\ &= \sum_{n=-10}^{-1} (-1) + \sum_{n=0}^0 0+ \sum_{n=1}^{20} 1 \\\ &= (-10)-(-11) + 0 + 20 \\\ &= 9 + 20 \\\ & = 29. \end{split}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$29$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The given sum equals \[\text{sgn}(-10) + \text{sgn}(-9) + \dots + \text{sgn}(-1) + \text{sgn}(0) + \text{sgn}(1) + \text{sgn}(2) + \dots + \text{sgn}(20),\]which comes out to $10(-1) + 1(0) + 20(1) = \boxed{10}.$
